docs.title: Introduction to AI and Robotics
docs.description: Welcome to the AI/Spec-Driven Book with Embedded RAG Chatbot. This educational resource focuses on ROS 2 as the middleware nervous system for humanoid robots, designed for AI students and developers entering humanoid robotics.

docs.title: Introduction to ROS 2 for Physical AI
docs.description: Learn the fundamentals of ROS 2 as a middleware nervous system for humanoid robots

docs.title: Module 1: The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)
docs.description: Welcome to the first module of our AI and Robotics educational book. This module focuses on ROS 2 as the middleware nervous system for humanoid robots, designed for AI students and developers entering humanoid robotics.

next.title: Introduction to ROS 2 for Physical AI

docs.title: Chapter 1: Physics Simulation with Gazebo
docs.description: This chapter introduces Gazebo as a physics simulation environment for humanoid robotics. Gazebo provides realistic physics simulation that allows you to test robot behaviors in a safe, controlled environment before deploying to real hardware.

next.title: Chapter 2: Digital Twins & HRI in Unity

docs.title: Chapter 2: Digital Twins & HRI in Unity
docs.description: This chapter focuses on creating high-fidelity digital twins using Unity and implementing Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) interfaces. Unity provides powerful visualization capabilities that complement physics simulation from Gazebo.

frontMatter.title: Chapter 2: Digital Twins & HRI in Unity

docs.title: Chapter 3: Sensor Simulation & Validation
docs.description: This chapter covers sensor simulation in both Gazebo and Unity environments, and techniques for validating simulated sensors against real-world data. Accurate sensor simulation is crucial for developing and testing perception algorithms.

previous.title: Chapter 2: Digital Twins & HRI in Unity

docs.title: Module 2: The Digital Twin (Gazebo & Unity)
docs.description: Welcome to Module 2 of our ROS 2 and Humanoid Robotics educational book. This module focuses on creating digital twins using Gazebo for physics simulation and Unity for high-fidelity visualization.

docs.title: Chapter 1: NVIDIA Isaac Sim for Photorealistic Simulation
docs.description: This chapter introduces NVIDIA Isaac Sim as a powerful platform for creating photorealistic simulations for humanoid robots. Isaac Sim enables the creation of high-fidelity virtual environments that can be used for training AI models, testing navigation algorithms, and generating synthetic data.

frontMatter.title: Chapter 1: NVIDIA Isaac Sim for Photorealistic Simulation

next.title: Chapter 2: Isaac ROS for VSLAM and Navigation

docs.title: Chapter 2: Isaac ROS for VSLAM and Navigation
docs.description: This chapter focuses on Isaac ROS, NVIDIA's collection of GPU-accelerated perception and navigation packages that integrate with the Robot Operating System (ROS). Isaac ROS provides accelerated computer vision, visual SLAM (VSLAM), and navigation capabilities specifically designed for robotics applications.

frontMatter.title: Chapter 2: Isaac ROS for VSLAM and Navigation

previous.title: Chapter 1: NVIDIA Isaac Sim for Photorealistic Simulation

next.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoid Robots

docs.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoid Robots
docs.description: This chapter focuses on adapting the Navigation2 (Nav2) stack for humanoid robots. Unlike wheeled robots, humanoid robots have unique constraints related to bipedal locomotion, balance, and step planning that require specialized path planning approaches.

frontMatter.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoid Robots

previous.title: Chapter 2: Isaac ROS for VSLAM and Navigation

docs.title: Module 3: The AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac™)
docs.description: Welcome to Module 3 of our ROS 2 and Humanoid Robotics educational book. This module focuses on NVIDIA's Isaac ecosystem for creating AI-driven robotic brains, covering photorealistic simulation, accelerated perception, and intelligent navigation for humanoid robots.

next.title: Chapter 1: NVIDIA Isaac Sim for Photorealistic Simulation

docs.title: Chapter 1: VLA Foundations
docs.description: This chapter introduces the fundamental concepts of Vision-Language-Action (VLA) systems, exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can be integrated with robotics to create intelligent, responsive robotic systems that understand and execute natural language commands.

docs.title: Chapter 2: Voice-to-Action (Whisper)
docs.description: This chapter focuses on implementing voice command processing using OpenAI Whisper for robotics applications. You'll learn how to convert spoken commands into text that can be processed by LLMs and converted to robotic actions.

docs.title: Chapter 3: Cognitive Planning (LLMs)
docs.description: This chapter focuses on using Large Language Models (LLMs) for cognitive planning in robotics. You'll learn how to translate natural language commands into detailed action plans that can be executed by ROS 2 systems, enabling robots to understand and execute complex, multi-step tasks.

docs.title: Chapter 4: Capstone: Autonomous Humanoid
docs.description: This capstone chapter brings together all the components learned in previous chapters to create a complete autonomous humanoid system. The robot will receive voice commands, plan complex multi-step tasks using LLMs, navigate through environments, identify objects using computer vision, and manipulate them.

docs.title: Module 4: Vision-Language-Action (VLA)
docs.description: Welcome to Module 4 of our ROS 2 and Humanoid Robotics educational book. This module focuses on the convergence of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Robotics, specifically on Vision-Language-Action systems that enable robots to understand natural language commands and execute complex tasks.

previous.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoid Robots

docs.description: This reference guide provides comprehensive information about sensor simulation in both Gazebo and Unity environments for humanoid robotics applications.

docs.title: Gazebo Simulation Tutorial
docs.description: This tutorial will guide you through setting up and running a basic Gazebo simulation for a humanoid robot.

docs.title: Sensor Simulation Tutorial
docs.description: This tutorial will guide you through implementing and validating various sensor simulations in both Gazebo and Unity environments, focusing on LiDAR, cameras, and IMU sensors for humanoid robots.

docs.title: Unity Digital Twin Tutorial
docs.description: This tutorial will guide you through creating a digital twin of a humanoid robot in Unity and implementing basic Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) interfaces.

docs.description: Learn how to create and validate URDF files for humanoid robots
